intro: Pithecoctenium guianense, commonly known as the Guianan pithecoctenium, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
